meanings.definition: To assign a lower rating or score to something.
meanings.sent1: She always downrates the movies she doesn't like.
meanings.sent2: The teacher downrates assignments that are turned in late.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly downrates his own cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The storm downrates the stability of the old building.
meanings.sent5: The judge downrates the performance for lack of preparation.

meanings.definition: To decrease the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: Constant use of a product can downrates its quality.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting maintenance can downrates the value of a car.
meanings.sent3: The spilled drink downrates the attractiveness of the outfit.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments downrates the importance of the achievement.
meanings.sent5: The lack of care downrates the beauty of the garden.

meanings.definition: To criticize or belittle someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She tends to downrates others to make herself feel superior.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to constantly downrates your friends' ideas.
meanings.sent3: He playfully downrates his own fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words downrates the morale of the team.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments downrates the efforts of the volunteers.
